title: Route contact-form WhatsApp CTA to a dedicated number while keeping default site WhatsApp chat

requirements.summary: Change the post-submission WhatsApp CTA to prefill the contact details and target +919181768591.
acceptanceCriteria: After a successful contact form submission, the rendered WhatsApp CTA opens a wa.me link targeting +919181768591.
The WhatsApp prefilled message includes the submitted fields (name, email, optional phone, message) as it does today.

file_operations.description: Update the success-state WhatsApp link generation so it uses the dedicated contact-form WhatsApp number from centralized config (targeting +919181768591) while preserving the existing prefilled message format (name, email, optional phone, message).

requirements.summary: Keep all non-form WhatsApp links/buttons targeting +919182768591 while allowing the form-success CTA to use +919181768591.
acceptanceCriteria: The default WhatsApp button (e.g., on the Contact page “Prefer to Chat?” section and other global WhatsApp links) continues to open a WhatsApp chat to +919182768591.
The WhatsApp CTA shown after form submission (with prefilled details) targets +919181768591 (and not +919182768591).
The implementation does not break existing WhatsApp link generation (still uses the existing WhatsApp deep link format).

file_operations.description: Ensure the default WhatsApp button continues to use the site-wide (general) WhatsApp deep link from config (+919182768591), while still allowing an explicit link prop (used by the contact-form success CTA) to override it.

Verify the Contact page’s non-form WhatsApp areas (e.g., “Prefer to Chat?” and contact info WhatsApp link) continue using the general WhatsApp config (+919182768591), while the post-submission CTA uses the dedicated contact-form number (+919181768591).

requirements.summary: Centralize both WhatsApp numbers in frontend configuration and ensure WhatsApp CTA user-facing labels are English.
acceptanceCriteria: Both +919181768591 and +919182768591 are represented in a single configuration source (e.g., frontend/src/config/site.ts) and consumed by the Contact page logic.
No new user-facing text is introduced in a non-English language.

file_operations.description: Refactor WhatsApp configuration to include two distinct values in one centralized source: a general site WhatsApp chat number/link (+919182768591) and a dedicated contact-form-details WhatsApp number (+919181768591). Keep existing CTA label strings in English.

Consume the refactored WhatsApp config so the contact-form success CTA uses the dedicated contact-form number and all other WhatsApp links continue using the general site WhatsApp configuration; ensure any added/changed CTA labels remain English.
Update footer WhatsApp link usage to align with the refactored centralized WhatsApp config (general site WhatsApp chat stays +919182768591), avoiding hard-coded numbers in the component.
